Title:
A taxonomic revision of the genus Conidiobolus
(Ancylistaceae, Entomophthorales): four clades including three new
genera
Keywords:
Zygomycetes  Entomophthorales  Morphology Phylogeny  New
taxa
Abstract:
Conidiobolus is an important and special group in
entomophthoroid fungi, and considered to be polyphyletic in recent
molecular phylogenies. To revaluate and delimit the genus Conidiobolus,
multi-locus phylogenetic analyses were performed using the large and
small subunits of nuclear ribosomal DNA (nucLSU and nucSSU), the small
subunit of the mitochondrial ribosomal DNA (mtSSU) and the translation
elongation factor 1-alpha (EF-1α). The result conformed that the
Conidiobolus is not monophyletic, being grouped into four clades, with a
recovered genus Delacroixia and three new genera Capillidium,
Microconidiobolus and Neoconidiobolus. Consequently, the wellknown
Conidiobolus was rejected and 34 new combinations were proposed.
